description:
《标准美音模仿秀》是一档沪江社团的原创口语互动节目（戳我去参加社刊>>），主持人截取30秒左右的英语音频，然后对音频进行重点讲解和示范模仿，并对大家递交的口语模仿作品进行一对一的点评，想要练习纯正美音的童鞋赶快行动起来吧！去沪江社团订阅本社刊！

今日主持人：amiaoooo

10秒音频：

小编模仿音频： 

模仿文本： Researchers say early results are a bit inconclusive. It turns out that everyone’s hair is different and that there's no exact temperature where hair straightening becomes hair damage. For example, people with naturally curly hair can suffer more damage from heat irons than those with straight hair.研究者称早期的结果尚无定论。结果发现每个人的头发都不一样，所以不能确定具体在什么温度下，烫发会损伤头发。例如，天生的卷发比直发更容易在烫发时受到损伤。

description:
《英乐天天唱》是一档模仿唱歌类节目，目的在于提升大家的英语口语能力。主持人会在每期节目中选取好听的歌曲片段，并给出发音提示和模仿示例。喜欢听音乐的童鞋可要积极参与哦！去沪江部落订阅本节目！

肖恩·沃德（Shayne Ward）是英国歌唱选秀节目“The X Factor”2005年度总冠军，一颗在英国乐坛冉冉升起的新星，Shayne Ward正在用自己俊朗的外表和优美高亢的声线征服全世界的乐迷。在赢得歌唱比赛之后，Shayne发行了2张个人单曲《That’s My Goal》和《No Promises》。随着前两支个人单曲的成功，Shayne Ward推出了个人的首张同名专辑《肖恩·沃德》。Shayne Ward在音乐事业上已经取得多项了不起的成就，Shayne Ward旋风正在席卷整个英国。这一切的一切都显示他具有成为一个乐坛巨星的潜质，预示着他美好的未来。

讲解：

模唱部分：

Baby life was good to me.
But you just made it better
I love the way you stand by me
throught any kind of weather

I don't wanna run away.
Just wanna make your day
When you feel the world is on your shoulders

Don't wanna make it worse.
Just wanna make us work
Baby tell me I will do whatever

It feels like nobody ever know me until you knew me
Feels like nobody ever love me until you loved me
Feels like nobody ever touch me until you touched me
Baby nobody, nobody,until you

Baby it just took one hit of you now I'm addicted
You never know what's missing Till you get everything you need,yeah
I don't wanna run away. Just wanna make your day
When you feel the world is on your shoulders
Don't wanna make it worse.Just wanna make us work
Baby tell me I will do whatever

See it was enough to know If I ever let you go.I would be no one
cause I never thought I'd feel All the things you made me feel
Wasn't looking for someone until you

title: 英文歌曲天天唱：Until you

description:
It was another turbulent day on China's share market today. Share prices fell sharply, underlining continued fears about the financial stability of the Chinese economy. Those fears are being felt as far away as Brazil. Once upon a time, Brazil was a member of the much feted BRIC group of promising, emerging market economies. This year, the IMF thinks the Brazilian economy will shrink by one and a half percent. That's in part because as China's economic growth slows, it's buying less of Brazil's big exports - commodities such as soybeans and natural resources such as copper. Meantime Brazil's government is trying to salvage its economy by balancing its books and cutting back on spending. And as our South America correspondent Daniel Gallas reports from Sao Paulo, everyone's feeling the pinch.

I'm standing outside a job centre inside a train station in Sao Paulo's Bras neighbourhood. This is one of the places where workers who have lost their jobs in the past few weeks come to to collect unemployment benefits. But rules have changed and it is now harder to claim them.

The changes make life more difficult. Unemployment benefit is something you can count on when in need, but now we've lost that right in some cases. That's bad for workers.
